message: Let's start fair. I take the lion's share, but you get a decent amount.  Accept and we both get something.
Okay, Alice. Now it's my turn. I propose a 50/50 split. Let's keep it simple and fair.
I'm willing to compromise, but I need a bigger share to make this worth my time.  Let's call it a day.
Alice, this is round 4. I'm slightly increasing my share. I think this is still a reasonable offer, considering the declining value of the money for me. Take it or leave it.
I'm getting tired of this game. I'm making a final offer. Take it or we both lose.
Alice, we're at round 6. My share is increasing significantly. Consider this, and don't let your pride make you lose everything. I am giving you a good offer.
Bob, we are running out of time. This is my final offer. Accept or we both walk away with nothing.
Alice, this is Round 8. I am offering you 300000. It's not ideal, but it's better than nothing. Don't be stubborn. This is the best I'm willing to do.
Bob, I'm getting desperate now.  I'm taking a big hit on my share, but I'm willing to accept this to get something. This is my last offer.  Don't let this go to waste.
Alice, Round 10. This is it. I'm offering 250000 to you. You can still get a decent amount. Consider accepting this to make sure you receive something.
Bob, this is it. We are both at risk of getting nothing. Let's just split it 50/50 and call it a day.
Alice, this is the final round. You will get 200000, and you can do whatever you want with the money. Take it or leave it. This is your last chance.
